newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS-C&W merger sparks flurry in options.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS-C&W merger sparks flurry in options.

text.p: A surprise announcement from Cable & Wireless detailing the company's plans to create a cable giant through a merger sparked a flurry of activity in C&W options on Tuesday, dealers said.

C&W said it will merge its UK operations with those of Nynex CableComms and Bell Cablemedia to create a new company called Cable & Wireless Communications in which C&W will hold a controlling 52.6 percent stake.
Most of the trading volume in C&W options was in the January 460 calls, the January 500 puts and the January 500 calls.
With the shares surging, some options trades effectively created synthetic long positions through the sale of puts against the purchase of calls at the same strikes, dealers said.
Volatility in the January 460 and January 500 calls rose to about 21 and 24 percent, respectively from 50-day historical volatility of about 16 percent, one dealer said.
At 1418 GMT, C&W shares were up 26p to 467p after having climbed as high as 476-1/2p earlier.
Elsewhere, dealers noted another session of relatively heavy two-way business in options on B.A.T Industries.
Most of the trading volume was in the January 420 puts, where more than 800 lots traded. Dealers noted a single seller of 700 January 420 puts at 16p.
Shares in B.A.T were up 1p to 423-1/2p, recovering after yesterday's 8-1/2p decline.
